alert.note: Alert for Cobb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:54PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattahoochee River at US 41 at Atlanta affecting Cobb and Fulton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at US 41 at Atlanta. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs in the woodlands and portions of the Chattahoochee National Recreation Area along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Cobb Parkway. The flood waters will reach the top of the concrete boat ramp in the recreation area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM EST Tuesday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 03/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EST.
